Portal 2 has a very funny and enjoyable single-player storyline, which makes single-player very fun and long lasting experience. You will spend a while just finishing single-player. But if you want to play even more, grab a friend and a testing chamber built by other people, or maybe yourself. People can make amazing tests; sometimes it's just fun to wander around the market and see other people's creations. Anyway, Portal 2 has infinite hours of gameplay and has a very funny, great storyline. I would highly recommend this game.

Sorti en 2007 avec l'Orange Box, parmi des titres comme Half-Life 2 et le très attendu Team Fortress 2, Portal avait fait forte impression en proposant un concept ne ressemblant à rien de connu. Bien que très court, ce jeu de réflexion à la première personne avait séduit les joueurs par son gameplay accrocheur mais surtout grâce à son ambiance particulière et par l'humour pince-sans-rire de GLaDOS, l'intelligence artificielle mégalomane. Valve nous revient quatre ans plus tard avec une suite aux petits oignons.

Portal 2 reprend donc les bases posées par son aîné. Ayant pour seule "arme" le désormais célèbre Portal Gun, le joueur va devoir venir à bout d'une séries de salles de tests. Malgré plusieurs ajouts renouvelant le gameplay (les flux, les gels...), le fond reste assez inchangé et se révèle toujours aussi intelligent. C'est avant-tout par la forme que ce deuxième opus se démarque de son prédécesseur. Si Portal laissait seulement entrevoir au joueur un univers intéressant, Portal 2 nous offre quant à lui une aventure inoubliable au cœur d'Aperture, pleine d'humour et surtout plus longue et plus variée. Les monologues des différents protagonistes, le scénario et la mise en scène ont été extrêmement soignés, et certains passages sont des véritables leçons de level design. Seule ombre au tableau, les temps de chargement trop fréquents que l'on doit au moteur Source vieillissant. Mais on pardonne ce petit défaut bien vite tant le reste de l’œuvre incarne la perfection. Une expérience vidéoludique incomparable, à savourer seul ou à deux dans l'excellent mode coop.

C'est donc sans hésitation que je me joins à l'euphorie collective en criant moi aussi au génie. Et je pense sans exagérer qu'on tient là un des meilleurs jeux vidéo de tous les temps, dont l'univers et en phase de devenir culte (s'il ne l'était déjà grâce au premier opus). Comment ne pas tomber sous le charme des tourelles, du robot Wheatley et de Cave Johnson ? Sans oublier GLaDOS qui sera bien évidemment à nouveau de la partie. Un jeu à mettre entre toutes les mains.

You all have heard the hype of this game already, so my vote is another "Yes, get this game".  Great sequel to Portal 1, presenting a lot of new challenges and story.  The part most people are enjoying is the multiplayer co-op.  It's extremely challenging but also fun, and there's even humor.  I recommend you using voice communication with your co-op partner, but do what you want.

Great first-person, physics-based puzzle game with an interesting story.  Good replay value from extra test chambers, the big amount of multiplayer levels, and just challenging yourself to do a puzzle faster or better.

Portal probably needs little introduction, as a pretty major hit upon release, although it was more of a proof-of-concept that got by on its gimmick of, well, portals and the disturbingly charming (if it can be called that) game atmosphere. Portal 2, then, can be considered the realization of Portal as a full-fledged game, giving Aperture Science and its inhabitants more characterization and exploration (Wheatley is awesome!), as well as introducing an array of new gameplay mechanics, including [spoiler]refracting laser beams[/spoiler], [spoiler]hard light[/spoiler], [spoiler]gels[/spoiler], and [spoiler]tractor beams[/spoiler].

In this specific sense, Portal 2 is more of what the original Portal promised and delivered on. If that interests you, I would say that you can probably stop reading this now, and that that alone probably merits a purchase; the game is relatively cheap now, especially during the myriad sales that show up. Co-op (which is a separate mode, not a retreading of single player) also exists this time around, and makes for some interesting puzzles with a friend (though probably not quite as hard as single player, if challenge is what you seek).

Still, while it is Portal at heart, I will note one particular regression. While there are definitely many nicely designed levels, there are also quite a few poorly designed ones. Specifically, there are many puzzles where the challenge comes from nothing other than finding the obscure, hidden portal-supporting surface, from which the solution tends to fall into place immediately afterwards. This gets particularly annoying during the [spoiler]original Aperture Science[/spoiler] testing chambers, where these kinds of puzzles crop up [i]between[/i] testing chambers and effectively waste unnecessary time.

And, like many puzzle games, Portal 2 doesn't really have much replay value; sure, you can attempt speedruns or other challenges, but those are universal and not particularly applicable to Portal 2. While DLC and user-created content theoretically helps get around this, I haven't really seen much interest in those (and I haven't tried them myself), and you should probably interpret the high critical score as "Portal 2 was executed very well" rather than "Portal 2 will always be remembered as a landmark video game".

In short, Portal 2 is more Portal goodness, and that is almost certainly a very good thing. But there can always be too much of a good thing (well, except money).

Though it is redundant to write a review for such a famous game, I just cannot surppress my passion for it.

Portal2, similar to its precedent, is a first-person physics-based puzzle game. Player need to solve different puzzles in chambers, by using a special gun and interacting with various game elements. Compared with Portal1, Portal2's world is bigger, story thicker, and the character development more surprising. The jokes and sarcasms from two robots, GLaDOS and Wheatley, make this interesting game even more funny (:'(though sometimes those sarcasms are too brutal). Besides, what surprised me is that the single-player mode is only the game's first half, and the multi-players mode provides players a even more interesting and challenging experience. Also, surpporting Steam Workshop greatly increases Portal2's re-playability.

But the advantages above are still insufficient to make Portal2 a masterpeice. As a puzzle game, what disdinguishs Portal2 from others is its ABILITY TO COMBINE. Firstly, there is a common drawback among other puzzle games: fragmented story. It is very hard to write a continuous story when puzzles' types are the same, for the repetition greatly weakens the reality. To solve it, most puzzle game choose to write a fragmented but poetic story(ie. Braid, the Bridge, etc.). Therefore, players need to create the whole story by themselves from bits and pieces. I think this method is every wise, but that how Portal solves it is phenomenal. Portal2 not only has a continuous story, but also connects every puzzle logically. For example, when "I" was handling with those discarded old chambers on the bottom of the facility, players will realize that the "puzzles" has been extended out of chambers. "I" need to solve puzzles not only to beat chambers, but also to reach the next chamber. Thus, Portal2 perfectly combines the puzzles with story, and reality with repetition. Secondly, Portal2 combines an element of action with puzzles. During the game, player will experience escape, exploration and even a Boss battle! Although its topic is puzzles-solving, players can still enjoy an exciting adventure. Thus, due to its continunous story and action element, actually I prefer classifying Portal2 as a action-adventure game to a puzzle game.

Finally, I want to say somehing about game elements. My favorite one is white Conversion Gel, which allows surfaces to accept portals. The reason is that it hides the solution to puzzles, and creates countless probabilities. In most case, solutions are so sensible that players can understand them immediately (if you find small white areas exist somewhere strange and isolated, you definitely will find them useful). But the white gel makes it impossible. Therefore, this stuff converts "to use existed conditions" to "to create conditions". Besides, it gives us a big hint of how to defeat Wheatley. Do you remember how white gel was invented? LOL

In conclusion, Portal2 is a unmatchable game which will be remembered forever. It is concise, it is intriguing, it is classic.

Portal 2, ein Spiel von der Valve Coperation, die dieses Spiel entworfen haben. Sie sind ebenfalls die Entwickler von Steam, also nicht sehr unbekannt. Im Spiel Portal 2 schlüpft man (im Singleplayer) in die Rolle von Chell. Die nach dem 100 jährigen Schlaf wieder aufwacht und versucht mit Reatly , einem Hilfdroiden aus Aperture Science zu fliehen, doch stattdessen erweckt er Glados (K.I aus Portal 1) und nutzt sie für sich und übernimmt die gesamte Anlage.Anders als in Portal 1 sieht man in Portal 2 sehr viele Gegenden ausserhalb von den Testkammern. Ebenfalls wurde die Physikengine in Portal 2 nochmal überarbeitet , um noch mehr Raum für die verschiedensden Rätsel zu geben. Die Singleplayer-Kampagne hat eine Spielzeit von 10 Spielstunden.
Im Koop dürft ihr zu zweit mit Robotern die Testkammern unsicher machen. Im Koop gibt es insgesamt 40 Level, wobei der Koop Modus nicht so viel Umfang, wie der Singleplayer hat. Nun zur Musik. Die Musik in Portal 2 ist meistens nicht besonders abwechslungsreich, dafür aber immer stimmig. Meistens hört man Cyborg-artige Musik, die mir sehr gut gefallen hat und mit den Hintergrundgeräuschen, wie dem Wind oder dem Einstürzen von Objekten sehr gut hamoniert.Vorallem im Singleplayer.
Die veraltete Source-Engine ist nicht mehr auf dem neusten Stand, wenn man darüber hinweg sieht gibt es aber nichts negatives , was mich gestört hat. Wer nach dem Koop oder Singleplayer immer noch rätseln möchte, der kann die Communitykammern ausprobieren, wo es z.B auch Rennstrecken gibt,Bossgegner etc. Alles in allen ein gutes Spiel, was mit einem guten Singleplayer- und Multiplayermodi punktet, vor allem mit den Communityteskammern.

Брать или нет наверное этот вопрос можно не задавать ведь эта игра идеальна, (особенно в кооперативе) ведь придумывать хитрый план с напарником, чтобы перебраться на другую часть карты это так здорово. Так же хочу отметить одиночную компанию, она просто великолепна, озвучка наилучшая, графика достойная и сюжет так же на высоком уровне. Valve молодцы!

Portal 2是經典遊戲Portal的續作，除了畫質提升不少外，
謎題的樣式與道具機關也大幅增加，遊戲總時間也達到兩倍以上。
劇情方面有更多衝突點，結局也讓人驚奇。
原則上與一代有所連結，由於一代相當便宜，請一併帶回家。

Portal系列經典的空間魔術完整保留，加上特殊的油漆、波動，
讓單純的傳送門變得更具挑戰性，也因此讓主角可以抵達更高的地方，
進行更危險、更刺激的動作。
本次更導入合作遊戲，讓單機的樂趣成為多人的娛樂。

美中不足的，系統在讀取方面還是偏慢，但是謎題的進化完全彌補了這個缺失。
沉浸在謎題中，會讓人不知不覺玩到半夜。
推薦給有耐心、對益智遊戲感興趣，或者正在尋找特別的射擊遊戲的玩家。

PS：建議一定要買組合包，只買一代或只買二代，真的玩不夠 :P
一起解開謎題的感覺很好，一定要試試看。
